topics.body:
"@twistedmetalero":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53cc1c516368723ab7d40000#post_53cc1c516368723ab7d40000
I shrugged them off too. But there was a period insecurity of time during my early secondary school years. But that is completely gone now. And I resent my secondary years for that. I still interact better with guys. But these anime and JRPGs made me regret skipping out on all those opportunities I had to get a girl. Believe me, I had a number of girls try to speak to me before my highschool years when I became sort of a loners. I'm trying to crawl out of that highschool phase. Highschool was the WORST time of my life, yet. Especially near graduation...

topics.body:
So I just got back from my VFW meeting, and had something I wanted to share with you lot, just because it made my day. I was talking to this older gent, a better than 60 year old vietnam vet who basing this just on my previous interactions with him I would have believed you if you told me he doesn't even old a computer.

Well I got into a conversation with him about Skyrim. And New Vegas. And Fallout 3. Turns out not only is he into these games, but he's more or less 100 percented all of them. Told me he got into them basically to help get his drinking under control, and said they were a big help.
